conclusion: Analyze the process on the P-V diagram to determine work done from state C to D.
Transition from state C to D occurs at constant pressure (isobaric process) with pressure at 0.75 x 10^5 Pa.
Volume at state C is 4 L and at state D is 3 L.
For an isobaric process, work done by the gas is W = p · ΔV.
Substitute values into the work formula: W = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa x (-1 L).
Convert volume from liters to cubic meters (1 L = 1 x 10^-3 m^3).
Calculate work: W = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa x (-1 x 10^-3 m^3) = -75 J.
The work done by the gas from state C to D is -75 J, indicating work is done on the gas.
